Overrated Poorly organized, hard to navigate books. Many icons are "off screen" and you have to figure which part of the empty areas of the screen to touch to get them to appear. This often leads to actions you don't want-like moving the page forward or back. Other actions, like returning to your library from a page in a book, are unneccessarily difficult. The library itself is poorly organized, titles are mixed with "samples". The user has to manually organize by "collections". Worst of all, are Amazon's "number of devices allowed" per title. Overly strict but worst of all, the only way to address the issue is thru a difficult to find web page. Always try to buy tittles somewhere else.

Used kindle for samsung for several years up until Samsung stopped the free monthly book service and updated the app accordingly. Ever since it had entirely ceased to work or sync and I lost all of my books even ones I had paid for across all devices (S8+ iPad 4 and a high end gaming pc win7 professional) . I deleted it and installed the original kindle app, this one here. It had resynced all of my data and worked for maybe a week. It has updated again and I have lost all of my books again across all devices. Even paid for books, the store wont load even on my high speed 5ghz wifi connection or full service 4gLTE cell service, so I cant even get back at LEAST the handful of unlimited books I have currently. Until Amazon can stop fixing what isn't broke and making everything worse I will be looking for another ebook app. I'm considering dropping all ties with Amazon totally. Every update reduces functionality and speed, becomes more complicated and clunky, and adds frustration across the board. Barnes and Noble + Netflix is looking to be the best option again for me. The convenience Amazon offers just doesn't seem worth it anymore.
